post_text:
For the past 5 months, it has been our honor to recognize Weatherford High School graduates who work in healthcare, are first responders, serve in the military, or work in the field of education. Since April 6th, we've recognized 155 former students at 7 pm each evening.

We want to continue this tradition of honoring our alums, but we're running out of nominations. To submit a nomination, please email information including a photo and the graduation year to clagrone@weatherfordisd.com.

#letskeepthisgoing #roopride

post_text:
Families now have the opportunity to change the learning pathway for their student for the 2nd Six Weeks of school that will begin on October 5, 2020. The following options are available to all families:
‚Ä¢ Families with students enrolled in the VLA may now choose learning at school
‚Ä¢ Families with students who are learning school may now choose the online pathway through the VLA

Important: Families who DO NOT want to change the learning pathway for their students do not need to complete the form.

The deadline to request a change in learning pathways is Thursday, September 17, 2020. If you have multiple children and wish to change pathways, please complete the pathway change form for each child.

***Additional information has been emailed to those listed as Family 1 in Skyward. Please check your email for further instructions.

post_text:
Tonight we are honored to recognize Ryan Whiteman from the WHS Class of 2002. After graduating from the Weatherford College Fire Academy, he started his career at Weatherford FD in 2008. He is an engineer for the department and serves as one of the founding members of the Weatherford Fire Department Honor Guard. He is an active member of the TIFMAS Wild Land Team, which is deployed to aid in wild land fires and other natural disasters in Texas and surrounding states. He is proud member of the fire prevention clown program ‚ÄúSquirt‚Äù who makes his way around elementary schools in Weatherford teaching kids about the importance of fire safety. #HometownHeroes #ThankYouForYourService #RooPride

This post is part of a series featuring WHS graduates who are making a difference in the healthcare, first responder field, or education. post_text: Welcome to Kangaroo Nation!
shared_text:
Weatherford High School Wrestling
September 3 at 10:31 PM ¬∑

We would like to introduce the new Weatherford girls head coach, Haley Heaton.

Haley wrestled 4 years at Saginaw High School. She was a 4X District Champ and a 2X Regional Champ. Haley was the UIL state champion 2012 and 2013, going undefeated her Senior year. She was also a National Runner-Up at Fargo Nationals and Body Bar Nationals in 2012. She graduated from Saginaw in 2013 with a 4.0 GPA and went on to wrestle at Oklahoma City University for 2 years on an athletic and academic scholarship. After 2 years of wrestling she decided to join the OCU cheer team and went on to win 2 National Championships. She graduated from OCU with a BS in Math with a minor in Physics. This will be her first year teaching and coaching.

We are so excited to have her leading our Weatherford girls! Welcome Haley Heaton to Roo Nation! üíô

#Bleedtheblue

Tonight we are honored to recognize Weatherford High School Theatre Arts teacher Jaclyn Justice from the WHS Class of 2004. Jaclyn was an active member of the choir program and Blue Belles where she served as a social officer and lieutenant. She earned a BA in English from UT Arlington in 2008, and is now beginning her 13th year teaching at WHS. She taught English and SAT prep for 6 years before moving to the Theatre Department, where she is now the head director. Jaclyn is also involved in Weatherford's local community theater, Theatre Off the Square, where she serves on the board of directors, as well as directs and acts in their productions. #HometownHeroes #ThankYouForYourService #RooPride

post_text:
We are SO excited for NASA astronaut Jeanette Epps who was named to the first operational crewed flight of Boeing's CST-100 Starliner spacecraft on a mission to the International Space Station this week! This past January, Jeanette Epps delivered a spellbinding presentation on the astronaut training program and NASA's Artemis program to our senior class. We'll be watching for her launch into space in 2021!

NASA press release: https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-astronaut-jeanette-epps-joins-first-operational-boeing-crew-mission-to-space

post_text: Weatherford ISD was made aware of an alleged discussion that occurred in a dual credit Government classroom taught by a Weatherford College instructor. We have long-standing positive relationship with Weatherford College and appreciate their swift attention to this matter.
shared_text:
Weatherford College
August 26 at 1:26 PM ¬∑

Today, Weatherford College was made aware of an allegation regarding political comments made by a faculty member teaching a dual credit course in an area high school.

We recognize that we are guests on our dual credit partner campuses, and we will respectfully work with their leadership in a student-centered relationship.

The aim of college-level coursework is to teach the material toward measurable learning outcomes, not to espouse any particular political viewpoint. Our Employee Procedures Manual states that ‚Äúwe will not engage in conduct that denigrates or shows hostility toward any individual‚Ä¶that creates an intimidating, hostile, or offensive academic environment.‚Äù

We cannot address a specific incident or instructor publicly, but we hold all of our faculty to high standards, and any issues brought forward by our dual credit partners are taken seriously and addressed as quickly as possible in the spirit of fairness to all parties.

We are appreciative of our longstanding relationship with our dual credit partners and look forward to years of continued partnership.

post_text:
Last night, new officers were elected to the Weatherford Council of PTAs - an organization that oversees our campus PTAs by offering training and support.

President - Sarah Davis (Curtis Elementary)
1st VP Membership - Ginger Lawless (Wright Elementary)
2nd VP Programs - Charlotte LaGrone (District Administration)
Secretary - Joy Bailey (Weatherford High School)
Treasurer - Joseph Scarbro (Curtis Elementary)

Outgoing president Shelah Nickols was thanked for the work she has done over the past 2 years at the Council PTA level. We are so proud of the Dinosaur George exhibit that our PTAs sponsored as a collaborative effort under Shelah's leadership. It's a great example of the benefit to students that results from the efforts of our campus PTAs!
shared_text:
Weatherford ISD
April 23 at 8:39 AM ¬∑

It's National Volunteer Week and our opportunity to send a big thank you our campus PTA officers and members! Our PTAs partner with school administrators and raise funds that are used to support our students and teachers. This year, five of our elementary PTAs sponsored the Dinosaur George traveling museum. By booking this exhibit as a group, our PTAs collectively saved over $6,000 and our students got to learn about dinosaurs in a fun and interactive setting. Here's a recap of the amazing Dinosaur George experience. #thankyoupta #nationalvolunteerweek

post_text:
We are honored to announce that Van Houser has been selected as one of only 15 recipients to be honored with the 2020 Texas State Board of Education's Heroes for Children Award! This prestigious award is given in recognition of outstanding volunteerism that benefits the students and staff of our school district.

For 19 years, Van has served on the Board of Directors for the Weatherford ISD Education Foundation, serving two terms as president from 2016-2018. Through the years, Van has provided his church as a free location for Weatherford ISD to host community events such as new teacher luncheons, ex-student association events, and Education Foundation events and meetings. He is frequently asked to be the pastor for our annual high school baccalaureate and also speaks to seniors who are the recipients of a private scholarship funded by members of our community. In 2013, Van was the recipient of Weatherford ISD‚Äôs Partnership Award, and in 2016, he was presented with the Outstanding Citizen of the Year award by the Weatherford Chamber of Commerce.

post_text:
Shout out to the WISD Technology Department! They are committed to providing outstanding tech support to our families who have selected the Virtual Learning Academy for the first six weeks. Today they helped 575 families with logins, reset passwords, and resolved an assortment of technology questions. We couldn't be more proud of this team!

Need to contact our Technology Department? Call 817-598-2915 between 8:00 am and 4:30 pm Monday-Friday.

Some families may have experienced delays in internet service today or issues with WISD Wi-Fi hotspots because of a T-Mobile outage that affected large portions of the United States. In addition, we anticipate there may be some temporary issues with speed and connectivity from content providers and companies that provide our learning management systems as more and more school district open and join in the online community.

Nikki is currently the Clinical Manager for Kindred Hospice, previously a hospice case manager, and prior a labor and delivery nurse. Nikki goes to work each day helping loved ones with hospice care for their family members at home and in the facility. She is absolutely amazing at what she does. Helping the patients and family embrace their quality time, while honoring their wishes during the time they have left. She also helps to honor those who have served in the line of duty through the We Honor Veterans program.
#HometownHeroes #ThankYouForYourService #RooPride

This post is part of a series featuring WHS graduates who are making a difference in the healthcare or first responder field. We'll feature a former student each evening, so be sure to check back every night at 7:00 pm. If you would like to submit a former student, please email information including their graduation year and a photo to clagrone@weatherfordisd.com .

post_text:
Weatherford ISD begins a new school year Thursday, August 20th and that means we'll welcome over 6,000 students who are learning at school.

For the safety of our students and community, please be aware that traffic around WISD campuses will be heavier than normal next week. Those who regularly travel on Bowie Drive and on Azle Highway are encouraged to find an alternate route between 7:30-8:00 am and 3:30-4:00 pm to avoid student drop off and pick up traffic.

As a reminder:
‚Ä¢ Obey the 20 mph speed limit within school zones.
‚Ä¢ In school zones, all drivers are prohibited from texting and using handheld devices while driving.
‚Ä¢ Use extra caution when traveling through school crosswalks.
‚Ä¢ Yield to pedestrians at all intersections.
‚Ä¢ Stop and wait for school buses when red lights are flashing.

Thanks for doing your part to provide safe student travel near all Weatherford ISD schools. It's going to be great year for Roo Nation!

post_text:
How do I receive text messages from Weatherford ISD?

Weatherford ISD offers parents and guardians the ability to participate and receive text alerts on your cell when Weatherford ISD sends out a SchoolMessenger message. With this service, you will receive text messages from WISD notifying you of inclement weather, safety alerts, school closings, or other important information about our school district.

To begin receiving text messages, text the word YES or OPTIN to the number 68453.

When you opt in to 68453, you will receive a text reply from SchoolMessenger. At any time, you may reply STOP to cancel the text messages.

(Replying YES or OPTIN to this post will not activate the text messaging service from SchoolMessenger.)

To begin receiving text messages, text the word YES or OPTIN to the number 68453.

When you opt in to 68453, you will receive a text reply from SchoolMessenger. At any time, you may reply STOP to cancel the text messages.

(Replying YES or OPTIN to this post will not activate the text messaging service from SchoolMessenger.)

All students enrolled in Weatherford ISD‚Äôs online Virtual Learning Academy are eligible to receive both breakfast and lunch. Meals will be distributed on Mondays and Wednesdays from 9:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. at the front entrance of Curtis Elementary located at 501 W. Russell.

On Mondays, breakfast and lunch will be provided for two days, and on Wednesdays, breakfast and lunch will be provided for three days.

‚Ä¢ Parents must bring identification and proof of each child‚Äôs enrollment in Weatherford ISD when picking up meals.
‚Ä¢ Meals will be charged to the student‚Äôs account according to their payment status, free, reduced, or paid.

post_text:
I have selected online learning in the Virtual Learning Academy for my child. How do I request assistance with technology?

WISD's Technology Department is lending devices to students enrolled in online learning - iPads for students in grades K-2 and Chromebooks for students in grades 3-12. Wi-Fi hotspots are also available for checkout to families whose children will be learning online but do not have internet access.

To begin the Virtual Learning Academy Technology Lending Request Form, click on this link. https://bit.ly/3kyhj9V

Parents will be contacted by their child's campus regarding pick up dates for technology and Virtual Learning Academy materials.

post_text:
Will there be STAAR tests during the 2020-2021 school year?

According to Mike Morath, Commissioner of the Texas Education Agency, Texas will administer STAAR testing during the 2020-2021 school year. However, in late July, Texas Governor Greg Abbott announced the grade promotion requirement related to the STAAR test for students in grades 5 and 8 has been waived for the 2020-2021 school year.

STAAR exams are given in grades three through eight, as well as in high school, and are used to measure how well students have mastered core subjects, including reading, writing and math.

To view the TEA Student Assessment Testing Calendar visit https://bit.ly/3fNhQBq

To view Governor Abbott‚Äôs press release regarding promotion requirements visit https://bit.ly/3acEHoO

post_text:
Will after school care be available at elementary campuses?

Yes! Enjoy the convenience and security of your child remaining at their school after the school day. The KIDS UNITE after-school program provides a safe, fun, nurturing, educational, and convenient setting for children to extend their learning beyond the regular school day.

KIDS UNITE is offered at each elementary campus for students in Pre-K through 5th grade and is available on school days from 3:20-6:30 pm.

Registration is now open for the 2020-2021 school year. To sign up or for more information, please visit https://bit.ly/33Fhvy4

post_text:
How do I request assistance for school supplies?

The Weatherford ISD Education Foundation believes every child should experience a great beginning to the school year...and that includes having the tools they need to be successful in the classroom. Since 2003, the Education Foundation has provided school supplies and/or backpacks for more than 20,000 students.

Weatherford ISD parents needing supplies for their children should contact their child's campus office or counselor to request assistance from the WISD Education Foundation's School Supply Closet.

post_text:
Where can parents find school supply lists?

Elementary and middle school supply lists for learning at school and learning online are posted on the Weatherford ISD website. To access these lists, click on the Smart Start Back to School image on the home page of the website. School supply lists are linked on the right side of the Back to School page.

To view school supply lists, copy and paste this link into your browser: https://bit.ly/30EkftS

*High school students will receive supply lists during the first week of school.

Tonight we are honored to recognize David Hilliard from the WHS Class of 1993. David is a Fire Captain/EMT with the Directorate of Emergency Services in Fort George G. Meade, Maryland. He holds 27 nationally recognized certifications in the fields of fire suppression, emergency medicine, technical rescue, fire administration and hazardous materials. He received his training from the University of Maryland's Fire Rescue Institute. His department provides an all-hazards response to one of the highest daytime populations and the state's largest employer. David lives near York, Pennsylvania. #HometownHeroes #ThankYouForYourService #RooPride

This post is part of a series featuring WHS graduates who are making a difference in the healthcare or first responder field. post_text:
Reminder: Deadline Today at Noon

Weatherford ISD is offering families the opportunity to select the learning environment that works best for your child for the first six weeks of school:

Option 1: Learning at school
Option 2: Remote, online learning through Weatherford ISD‚Äôs Virtual Learning Academy

While we want to see all of our students‚Äô smiling faces in our classrooms, we know that some of our families may want an online option for their children because of the COVID-19 virus. We respect your decision and encourage you to select the learning option that best fits your family.

Students who do not have a path selected will be enrolled in face-to-face learning for the first six weeks.

*Parents may request to change the learning environment near the end of the first six weeks.

post_text:
New! WISD families have the option of ordering elementary and middle school supplies online from the Weatherford ISD website.

Visit the Weatherford ISD website located at www.weatherfordisd.com
- Click on Online Payments (located on the right side of the home page)
- Click on the tile for TeacherLists
- Select your child's campus
- Select the appropriate grade level supply list
- At the top right side of the page, you'll see the wording: Buy this list
- Click on the preferred store (Staples, Amazon, Target, Walmart, or Office Depot)
- Select "Pick up at the store" or "Ship to your address" for local store locations
- Edit your shopping cart
- Complete the check out process

* High school students will be given school supply lists by teachers during the first week of school.

**Families needing assistance with school supplies should contact their child's principal, assistant principal, or counselor.

post_text: Happy System Administrator Appreciation Day to our amazing employees in the WISD Technology Department! Following our closing in the spring, they prepared and distributed over 2,000 devices to WISD students to support their learning at home. On a daily basis, they protect WISD staff from spam, viruses, malware, and spyware. They train us up and take care of us when we have technical issues...all with a willing heart and a smile on their face. #HappySysAdminDay

Tonight we are honored to recognize Joshua Kerfoot from the WHS Class of 2020. Joshua has served as a volunteer firefighter with ESD-6 since 2017. He is a true hero from our high school and an exemplary role model having performed life saving treatment to patients with his fire department, and on rides with MedStar in Fort Worth. His goal is to become a firefighter paramedic. Joshua is a shining example of the type of student that graduates from Weatherford High School and our CTE classes! #HometownHeroes #ThankYouForYourService #RooPride

post_text: The deadline to apply for P-EBT food benefits has been extended to August 21, 2020. Did your child receive free or reduced-price school meals through the National School Lunch Program during the 2019-2020 school year? If so, your family may be eligible for this one-time food benefit. Visit hhs.texas.gov/pebt to learn more about P-EBT. For questions regarding eligibility or if you need help applying, contact the P-EBT Call Center at 833-613-6220. The public charge rule does not apply to P-EBT benefits.

post_text: Congratulations to Jerry Logan, our former Director of Custodial Services! Jerry was announced as one of the 2020 inductees into the Big Country Athletic Hall of Fame. Born and raised in Graham, TX, he attended Graham High School and West Texas State University. Logan started 155 straight games for the Baltimore Colts, from his rookie year in 1963 to his retirement a decade later. He was selected to the Pro Bowl three times, helped the Colts win 5 division championships, an NFL title, and Super Bowl V with the Baltimore Colts. He retired from Weatherford ISD in 2010 after 12 years of service.

He retired from Weatherford ISD in 2010 after 12 years of service.

post_text:
Weatherford ISD Families -

I hope this message finds you and your family well.

Today, the Texas Education Agency announced that Texas schools may delay the start of the school year or limit in-person schooling for the first four weeks of 2020-2021. This information was announced this morning prior to any school district in Texas being given the opportunity to review details. As a result, our team will be studying the information released today and consulting with local officials to determine how this new information might affect Weatherford ISD.

In the meantime, Weatherford ISD is finalizing plans for the 2020-2021 school year. This information will be released to families and staff on Tuesday, July 21.

Please be patient with us as we plan for a safe start to the 2020-2021 school year while navigating the changes resulting from the COVID-19 virus. We will communicate with you as we learn new information or need to modify existing plans.

All the best,

Dr. Beau Rees
Superintendent of Schools

https://bit.ly/30oCKRk
shared_text:
TEA.TEXAS.GOV

This information was announced this morning prior to any school district in Texas being given the opportunity to review details. As a result, our team will be studying the information released today and consulting with local officials to determine how this new information might affect Weatherford ISD.

In the meantime, Weatherford ISD is finalizing plans for the 2020-2021 school year. This information will be released to families and staff on Tuesday, July 21.

post_text:
WISD Families:

I trust everyone had an incredible 4th of July and that you and your loved ones are well.

Late this afternoon, Weatherford ISD along with school districts across the state received updated guidance from the Texas Education Agency regarding the start of the 2020-2021 school year. Our team will be reviewing these new guidelines as we plan for the safe reopening of classroom instruction at school and online learning. Our goal is to communicate further information to you later next week.

Thank you,

Dr. Beau Rees
Superintendent

https://tea.texas.gov/about-tea/news-and-multimedia/news-releases/news-2020/tea-issues-comprehensive-guidelines-for-a-safe-return-to-on-campus-instruction-for-the-2020-21-school-year

post_text:
Weatherford ISD has been notified that an individual in the tennis program has been diagnosed with Covid-19. Families whose students had direct contact with this individual have already been notified. If you did not receive a phone call, email, and text this morning, your student has not been in direct contact with this individual.

The safety of our students and staff is always our first priority. This is the third notification of a positive Covid-19 diagnosis associated with the athletic program. With the advice of Dr. Welch Weatherford ISD‚Äôs Kanga Care physician, and out of an abundance of caution, the strength and conditioning program will be closed for two weeks with plans to reopen on Wednesday, July 22, 2020.

post_text:
Weatherford ISD has been notified that a student participating in the strength and conditioning program on the Weatherford High School campus tested positive for Covid-19. Emails informing the 23 students who had either indoor or outdoor contact with this student were sent to families yesterday. Phone calls and texts were also sent to these parents asking them to check their email. Out of an abundance of caution, all students participating in the strength and conditioning program were also notified.

The safety of our students and staff is always our first priority. Our custodial staff has completed a deep cleaning of the high school facilities and will conduct additional cleanings before the program reopens on Monday.

Parents who have questions about their student‚Äôs health may contact our Health Services department by email to Shealee Mitchell, WISD Nurse Coordinator at smitchell@weatherfordisd.com. Parents may also schedule an appointment for their student to be seen at our Summer Kanga Care Center by calling the appointment scheduling line at 817-458-3331.

The safety of our students and staff is always our first priority. Our custodial staff has completed a deep cleaning of the high school facilities and will conduct additional cleanings before the program reopens on Monday.

Saturday, June 13th from 8:00 am ‚Äì 10:00 am

*Children 2 and under will not need a ticket for entry.

üï∞ You set the schedule!
üìç Your home

Weatherford ISD‚Äôs Community Education department is offering a self-paced, 100% online art camp for kids! Students will create EIGHT different works of art in various mediums, including charcoal, watercolor and more. Supplies are included in the cost and will be shipped to you after registration.

Parents will be given a password to access the course taught by professional, award-winning artist, Susan Garden, and her student, Daniel. Sign up today! https://rb.gy/flsnml

post_text:
It's time for some Summer Reading FUN, Roos! Click on the following link to visit the WISD Summer Reading Virtual Campsite - https://bit.ly/wisdsummerreading.

Once there, you can click on the "Summer Reading" banner flying across the sky to visit the Weatherford ISD Summer Reading website, which includes information for BINGO, eBooks, reading lists, online challenges, and reward programs.

You can also click on your school/librarian to visit individual Campus Virtual Libraries! Go on a scavenger hunt around your campus library! Click on different objects to find tons of fun reading and Makerspace activities you can do at home this summer, and keep reading, Roos!

post_text:
Connor Bezio and Jack Waldron have been named the Valedictorian and Salutatorian, respectively, for the Weatherford High School Class of 2020!

Connor is the son of Renee' and William Bezio. He plans to attend Rice University (pending other acceptances) and major in math.

Jack is the son of Laura and Jason Waldron. He plans to attend DigiPen Institute in Technology located in Redmond, Washington to major in computer science and game design.

During their high school years, both students were members of the Weatherford Roo Bands and both play saxophone!

Join us in congratulating Connor and Jack on this outstanding honor!

post_text:
School nurse clinics are the first place a student goes when they don‚Äôt feel well. This year, from the beginning of the school year through March 13th, there were over 71,000 student visits to our nurse clinics!

Our school nurses are truly amazing. Last year, they converted their space into Kanga Care Clinics to offer access to telemedicine for our students and staff. This year, they provided additional training at every campus to ensure WISD was designated as a Project ADAM Texas Heart Safe School District.

Please join us in sending thanks to our school nurses who provide world-class care to our students and staff. #NationalSchoolNurseDay #RooPride

post_text:
To our teachers who‚Ä¶
- make history come alive for their students
- teach an entire class to read
- help students discover and develop their talents in art, band, choir, dance, or theater
- inspire a love of reading
- help students master a math course
- help students discover a love of science
- help students excel in their sport and develop sportsmanship
- teach soft skills
- provide social and emotional support

To our teachers‚Ä¶
- who in the midst of a pandemic, rose to the challenge of teaching students from their home
- who love and miss their students

To our teachers who do so much more than teach, we send our heartfelt thanks.

#HappyTeacherAppreciationWeek

post_text: We‚Äôre incredibly honored to recognize our Child Nutrition staff today on National School Lunch Hero Day. On a normal school day, they prepare healthy food while adhering to strict nutrition standards, navigating student food allergies, and offering service with a smile. On March 23rd, our Child Nutrition department took their service to a new level. We are so proud to announce they have prepared and distributed over 48,000 meals to children during our school closing. Please join us in honoring our employees on #SchoolLunchHeroDay! #RooPride

post_text: We can all use some new recipes...right? Sign up today for Monday‚Äôs online cooking class offered through Weatherford ISD Community Education.
shared_text:
Weatherford ISD Community Education
April 21 at 7:00 PM ¬∑

NEW ONLINE CLASS JUST ADDED!!!

We are thrilled to announce we have partnered with Joan Denton, RDN & classically-trained chef, to offer a 100% online cooking class on Monday, April 27th! Make the most of social distancing while learning to cook for both health and enjoyment, all from the comfort of your home!

"Culinary Medicine: Cooking to Strengthen Your Immune System"

This class will feature two hours of hands-on cooking, with three different recipes designed to boost your immune system. You will also learn the science behind the ingredients and the benefits for your body, which is as important as ever during these uncertain times.

üìÖ Monday, April 27th
üï∞ 6:30 to 8:30 pm
üìç Your kitchen
üíµ $25
To register ‚û°Ô∏è https://weatherfordisd.augusoft.net/index.cfm?method=ClassListing.ClassListingDisplay&int_category_id=1&int_sub_category_id=27&int_catalog_id=

Students will be emailed a supply list and meeting information after registering.

post_text: It's National Volunteer Week and our opportunity to send a big thank you our campus PTA officers and members! Our PTAs partner with school administrators and raise funds that are used to support our students and teachers. This year, five of our elementary PTAs sponsored the Dinosaur George traveling museum. By booking this exhibit as a group, our PTAs collectively saved over $6,000 and our students got to learn about dinosaurs in a fun and interactive setting. Here's a recap of the amazing Dinosaur George experience. #thankyoupta #nationalvolunteerweek

Weatherford Roo Bands
April 17 at 4:53 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to all who auditioned for drum major. Everyone who auditioned truly was an excellent candidate. I am looking forward to getting back to band next year with so many great leaders. Thank you so much to our outgoing drum majors: Alicia German, Jack Waldron and Vi Hilliard - thanks for being great examples this past year and leading the band back to a 1st division at UIL Marching Contest.

Your 2020-2021 Fightin‚Äô Roo Band Drum Majors are:

Emma Kincaid, head drum major
Landon Coye
Adison Feriend
Audrey Waldron

post_text:
We are so grateful to live in a community that supports our students and families.

In additional to the meals provided by the Weatherford ISD Child Nutrition department to children who are 18 or under, the Ministerial Alliance of Parker County has collected food for families in need. Families who need assistance may pick up a food box from First United Methodist Church of Weatherford Family Life Center located at 301 S. Main Street in Weatherford every Thursday evening in April from 5:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m.

Manna Storehouse Weatherford
Anyone from Parker County who is in need of groceries, whether registered with Manna or not, can call Manna at 817-599-6569 between 11 am and 1 pm Monday-,Friday to arrange to come by and get groceries.

Additional resources for groceries or meals may be found on the Parker County Center of Hope Facebook page.

As a reminder, Monday, April 20 is a scheduled holiday for Weatherford ISD. Meals to children will resume on Wednesday, April 22.

Dr. Renee Treat was named principal for Tison Middle School at tonight‚Äôs regular meeting of the WISD Board of Trustees. Dr. Treat holds a Bachelor of Science degree from McMurry University in education, communication, and English; a Master‚Äôs in Education from Midwestern State University in educational leadership, and a Doctorate in Education from Abilene Christian University in organizational leadership.

From 2006-2016, Dr. Treat served as an assistant principal, principal, and Director of Professional Development in Crowley ISD. Since 2016, she has served as the Director of Organizational Effectiveness at ESC Region 11. #WelcometoKangarooNation

March 30 at 10:39 AM ¬∑

Center of Hope is still in operation to serve our community while closely monitoring the COVID-19 situation. WAYS TO DONATE:

post_text:
During this time of social distancing and school closings, we are doing everything in our power to make sure our students have the opportunity to attend two traditional senior events ‚Äì graduation and prom.

‚Ä¢ While we are still planning to hold graduation on June 1st, we have secured Friday, July 24th at 7:00 pm as a backup date with the Fort Worth Convention Center. If we are unable to hold graduation at the Fort Worth Convention Center due to extended closures and social distancing requirements, we will move to a virtual graduation ceremony.
‚Ä¢ Our prom date of May 2nd was cancelled this week due to our extended closing, so we‚Äôre working to secure a date to host prom at Weatherford High School in July.

We know our school closing is necessary to minimize the impact of the COVID-19 virus in our community and we'll do all we can to hold these traditional events for our WHS senior class. #WHSClassof2020 #RooPride

post_text:
Jonathan Wagner has been named the boys head basketball coach for Weatherford High School. Coach Wagner has 24 years of coaching experience including leading Arlington Heights High School to the State Tournament in 2013. Most recently he has served as the boys head basketball coach at Wichita Falls High School.

‚ÄúI love coaching basketball,‚Äù Wagner said. ‚ÄúMy dream ever since I was in junior high school was to be a coach. I am the person I am today, partly because what my coaches invested in me. I want to be that person for the athletes of Weatherford ISD.‚Äù

Coach Wagner has a Bachelor of Science in Exercise and Sport Studies from Texas Wesleyan University. Please join us in welcoming Coach Wagner to the Kangaroo family!
text:

Coach Wagner has a Bachelor of Science in Exercise and Sport Studies from Texas Wesleyan University. Please join us in welcoming Coach Wagner to the Kangaroo family!

post_text:
Texas Governor Greg Abbott amended his Executive Order today, calling for all schools in the state of Texas to remain closed until May 4. This means all WISD campuses, offices, and facilities will remain closed to the public and all events and activities are canceled until May 4; student learning at home and curbside meal service will continue.

WISD administrators will continue to monitor updates, recommendations, and decisions from TEA Commissioner Mike Morath as well as local, county, and staff officials.

These are certainly unprecedented times and Weatherford ISD is committed to following these decisions that are designed to keep our students, staff, families, and community healthy.

post_text:
On Monday, March 23, 2020, Parker County Commissioners approved a 30-day declaration of local disaster in an effort to combat the spread of COVID-19 in our community. This declaration limits the size of gatherings to no more than 10 people and mandates the cancellation of all such gatherings of more than 10 people until further notice.

As a result of this declaration, Weatherford ISD has made the decision to close schools, offices, and facilities through April 21, 2020. At this time, we anticipate reopening schools on Wednesday, April 22, 2020.

For more information, please visit www.weatherfordisd.com.

For more information, please visit www.weatherfordisd.com.

post_text:
Beginning tomorrow...Monday, March 23, the Weatherford ISD Child Nutrition Department will offer free breakfast and lunch to any child age 18 and under at two elementary campus locations - Curtis and Ikard. Due to safety concerns for students walking on Bankhead Highway, pedestrian traffic at Ikard is discouraged.

For the health and safety of our families and staff, food will be delivered in a drive through format with no onsite dining. Please follow the traffic flow patterns shown in this post and remain in your vehicle. Under current Texas Department of Agriculture guidelines, meal service may only be provided to students who are present.

Meal Pick Up Locations - Curtis and Ikard
Serving Times 11-2 on Mondays and Wednesdays

Breakfast and lunch will be given at the same time.
Meals for 2 days will be given on Mondays; Meals for 3 days will be given on Wednesdays.

Weatherford ISD is launching the School News app by Edlio to add an additional layer of communication for our families, staff, and community. The School News app is aligned to our website and will provide you with news, events, and any alerts that may be announced.

This app is free to download to your iOS or Android phone and quick to set up:

1. Scan the QR code on this post or go to the App Store or Google Play and search for ‚ÄúSchool News by Edlio‚Äù to install.
2. Open the app and search for Weatherford Independent School District; tap ‚ÄúAdd School.‚Äù
3. Enable push notification by going to the Alerts tab and tapping ‚ÄúEnable Notifications.‚Äù

3. Enable push notification by going to the Alerts tab and tapping ‚ÄúEnable Notifications.‚Äù

post_text: Sharing this important message for our families in Horseshoe Bend.
shared_text:
Parker County Judge Pat Deen
March 18 at 6:21 AM ¬∑

Urgent notification to the residents of Horseshoe Bend, Lazy Bend Estate‚Äôs, Soda Springs River View Road, Thorp Springs Road, Hillcroft Drive, Springwood Drive, Gilbert Drive, Harris Drive Driftwood Ranch Trail, East Meadow Lane, N. Blue Stem Court, S. Old Tin Top Road Residents!

Due to receiving 4-5 inches in a two hour time period, the Brazos River Authority opened a 3rd/4th gate simultaneously at Possum Kingdom Lake's Morris Sheppard Dam at around 5:35 a.m. this morning, March 18. The release is 40,000 cfs. These gates were opened quickly to prevent cresting the damn.

It is projected to hit Horseshoe Bend in 18-24 hours which will be between 11:00 P.M.tonight through 5:00 A.M. Thursday morning.
We are activating our Emergency Operations Center and will issue a Blackboard Connect this early A.M to the affected areas.
Parker County EOC will continue to provide updates throughout the day on this serious situation.

I will sign a disaster declaration this morning allowing Parker County to qualify for State Resources.
Please share to those in the affected areas.

Due to receiving 4-5 inches in a two hour time period, the Brazos River Authority opened a 3rd/4th gate simultaneously at Possum Kingdom Lake's Morris Sheppard Dam at around 5:35 a.m. this morning, March 18. The release is 40,000 cfs. These gates were opened quickly to prevent cresting the damn.

It is projected to hit Horseshoe Bend in 18-24 hours which will be between 11:00 P.M.tonight through 5:00 A.M. Thursday morning.
We are activating our Emergency Operations Center and will issue a Blackboard Connect this early A.M to the affected areas.

shared_text:
Weatherford Public Library
March 17 at 10:13 AM ¬∑

In light of the new guidelines for limited public events, WPL will be canceling all children's events at the library until further notice. Note we said "at the library." We are working on bringing you virtual storytimes and events through Facebook Live. Until we get those in place, we will be making periodic posts with activities to keep the kiddos informed, engaged, and entertained. The first of those is a virtual storytime with "Pete the Cat" creator James Dean at noon today...check out Pete the Cat for more details!!

post_text:
When Weatherford ISD announced that schools and offices would be closed for three weeks, the staff of Wright sprang into action and checked out 10-20 books to every student in less than two hours! That's about 3,000 books from the library and 2,500 books from classroom libraries.

Families can also check out eBooks and eAudiobooks from the Weatherford Public Library. For more information, please visit, https://ci.weatherford.tx.us/1161/eBooks-and-eAudiobooks #WeatherfordStrong #ReadingMatters

post_text:
Weatherford ISD custodians follow deep cleaning processes throughout the school year to curb the potential spread of viruses, including Coronavirus. These include the use of hospital-grade disinfectants and an EMIST electrostatic disinfectant sprayer to cover all surfaces in classrooms and on school buses.

This morning, we emailed an updated message to families and staff regarding Coronavirus. While have not been notified of any presumptive positive cases in Parker County, we are aware of the first presumptive positive case of COVID-19 in Tarrant County.

To view the message, click on https://bit.ly/2TW2guj

post_text: Today a ceremony was held at the Veterans Memorial at Soldier Springs Park to dedicate the new pavilion and park area in memory and in honor of Chuck Katlic who served in the U.S. Army from 1943-45. Mr. Katlic was a great partner to WISD, bringing us new American flags to replace those that were showing wear, teaching our students how to reverently and properly retire worn flags, and giving presentations to our students. What a great tribute to a man, who through his tireless efforts in our community and his work with Weatherford ISD, taught us all the meaning of patriotism.
shared_text:
Paul Paschall checked in to Veterans Memorial at Soldier Springs Park.
March 10 at 4:31 PM ¬∑ Weatherford, TX ¬∑

Excellent ceremony at the Veteran‚Äôs Memorial at Soldier Springs Park this afternoon. The new pavilion and park area were dedicated to Chuck Katlic who served in the U.S. Army from 1943-45. Chuck had a wonderful appreciation for those who served and an amazing passion to remember those who gave all. This pavilion area of peace, tranquility and reflection were a vision that Chuck held close to his heart.

post_text:
Students from across the District filled the room at last night's school board meeting!

- Pre-K students in our Deaf Ed program at Bill Wright Elementary School along with students from Shirley Hall Middle School interacted with our school board using sign language to perform a song and to provide each board member with their name sign.

We also recognized:
- WHS senior Katlyn Don Carlos, for being named a National Merit Scholarship finalist.

- WHS students for taking first place at the Weatherford College Coyote Area Math Championship.

- WHS wrestling team students that placed at the District, Regional, and State competitions.

- WHS art students who medaled at the Texas High School Visual Arts Scholastic Event.

- The WHS UIL Competition Cheer Team that placed at the UIL Spirit State Championship.

- WHS varsity baseball player, Aaron Hayes, for pitching a perfect game.

Student leaders at Bose Ikard Elementary are developing soft skills such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving with two great initiatives. Student Ambassadors are collecting towels, blankets, and cat and dog food to donate to the Weatherford Animal Shelter through the end of March...and the Ikard PTA Roos in Action is hosting a Classroom Health Supply Drive to gather disinfectant wipes, tissues, and hand sanitizer from now until Friday, March 13th.
If you'd like to make a donation, please take items to the Ikard Elementary office.
#RoosCare #StrongCommunity

post_text:
Congratulations to senior Keaton Martin who received the 20 Under 20 Horizon Award from the Parker County Today Magazine!

Keaton initiated two key programs that have made an impact in our school district and at Weatherford High School. In 2017-2018 he helped create Weatherford ISD‚Äôs Roos Eyes Open. This initiative encourages students to report anonymously if they are aware of dangerous or suspicious activity.

He also worked with high school administrators this school year to establish the Sharing Shack ‚Äì a place on the high school campus were students can get clothing, toiletries, and school supplies.

Keaton is actively involved with Special Olympics Texas and has over 3300 hours of volunteer service through his high school years.

post_text:
The Weatherford ISD Board of Trustees selected Mr. Rod Townsend to serve as the interim superintendent while they undergo a search for a permanent candidate to replace Dr. Jeffrey Hanks who recently announced his retirement.

Mike Guest, WISD school board president said, ‚ÄúMr. Townsend has over 35 years of experience in public education that includes serving as superintendent of schools for Rochester, Hico, and Decatur ISDs. He also held several leadership positions with the Texas Association of School Administrators, including president in 2011-2012. Since his retirement in 2017, he has served as interim superintendent for both Spring Hill ISD and Peaster ISD.‚Äù

Rod Townsend will begin his term as interim superintendent for Weatherford ISD on March 23rd, the Monday after the district‚Äôs Spring Break.

Since his retirement in 2017, he has served as interim superintendent for both Spring Hill ISD and Peaster ISD.‚Äù

UPDATE: The accident has been cleared and buses have resumed their routes.

We have just been notified of an accident that occurred near Centerpoint Road. Some roads near that area may be shut down for up to an hour. As a result, buses 2, 5, 7, and 49 cannot travel their normal routes and may be delayed in picking up students who live near the accident location.

Former school board member Raymond George worked tirelessly to preserve history with the restoration of the Mount Pleasant School and he always made sure our students knew the importance of his work.

In honor of Black History Month, the Mount Pleasant School is available for free self-guided walkthroughs during the month of February. To schedule a walk-through please contact the Weatherford Parks, Recreation and Special Events Department at 817-598-4124.

A replacement bus has picked up students and is completing the route. As a result, students may be delayed in reaching their afternoon bus stops.

post_text:
We are closely monitoring this afternoon's forecast that indicates a chance of thunderstorms and the possibility of lightning at dismissal time. If lightning is in our area at dismissal, we will hold all students inside their campus until the lightning delay is lifted.

While we advise parents who are picking up children from campuses to remain in their cars during a lightning delay, you may choose to come to the office to pick up your child.

Buses will wait at campuses until it is safe for students to board and, as a result, may be delayed in arriving to bus stops this afternoon.

Thank you for your understanding as we implement bad weather processes that are designed to keep our children safe.

post_text:
Weatherford ISD administrators have been closely monitoring the weather and have consulted with a meteorologist from the National Weather Service (NWS) regarding tomorrow‚Äôs forecast.

At this time, the NWS meteorologist expects precipitation to begin around 3:00 am Wednesday morning with temperatures dropping at or below freezing by 6:00 am. We anticipate road conditions will worsen throughout the morning with freezing rain and/or sleet that is expected to last until 11:00 am with a possible accumulation of 2-3 inches.

Based on this forecast from the NWS, Weatherford ISD campuses and offices will be closed on Wednesday, February 5. All extracurricular and after school activities will also be cancelled.

post_text:
School Board members are volunteers who donate countless hours of their time each month to keep the commitment to today‚Äôs students. During the month of January, every school board member visited with the students and staff at an elementary campus.

Trustees receive no pay for their work. The time spent preparing for and attending school board meetings represents just a small fraction of the hours they devote to Weatherford ISD. They are required to attend seminars and training sessions to keep up with the latest changes in state and federal regulations and to learn trends in educational leadership. They are also deeply involved in our community, and spend many hours in our schools and at extracurricular events.

As School Board Recognition Month comes to a close, we send our sincere thanks to our Board of Trustees for their service to the students, staff, and community.

post_text: Weatherford ISD is committed to creating a safe and secure environment for our students and staff by proactively implementing processes to strengthen our safety and security processes and being transparent when communicating with our families. This week we were honored to present our safety, security, and communications processes to administrators throughout the state of Texas at the TASA Midwinter Conference. Our goal is to do everything within our power to keep your children safe while they are in our care.

post_text:
So proud that Weatherford ISD is one of only 15 school districts and 434 schools across Texas to be named a Project ADAM Heart Safe School District.

In collaboration with our campus nurses, each WISD campus has a designated a Cardiac Emergency Response team. This team has been trained in CPR and AED use and an implementation plan in the event of a Sudden Cardiac Arrest.

January 19 at 9:42 AM ¬∑

The Weatherford High School Competition Cheer Team competed at the UIL Spirit State Championship this weekend. On Friday they placed 7th in the 6A qualifying rounds, moving them into the State Finals where they finished 9th in the entire State of Texas 6A D2. They also earned 5th place overall in Crowd Leading, and the number one Cheer Score in the entire 6A D2 division during their finals performance. Congratulations WHS Cheer!

This afternoon a vehicle rear-ended Bus 24 near the intersection of Julie and Bowie Drive. There were no injuries to our students or bus driver, and only minimal damage to the bus.

As a precaution, students riding on this bus have been transferred to new bus and the Transportation Department is in the process of notifying parents.

We are most grateful that no injuries were sustained. Parents should be prepared for students to arrive home a little later than normal.

post_text:
One of our most proud moments over the last ten years came in October when Karen Sams, a 3rd grade teacher at Crockett Elementary, was named Texas Teacher of the Year!

Each spring, every campus in Weatherford ISD selects their campus Teacher of the Year. These teachers are honored at the Weatherford ISD Education Foundation‚Äôs annual Teacher of the Year luncheon where the WISD Elementary and Secondary Teachers of the Year are announced. These teachers then compete in the Region 11 Teacher of the Year competition.

At this year‚Äôs Region competition, Karen Sams was named the Region 11 Elementary Teacher of the Year. Karen was then announced as a finalist for the state competition and, in October, she was named the Texas Teacher of the Year!

Congratulations to Karen Sams! We wish you all the best in the national competition! #Day9 #adecadeofmemories

post_text:
For Day 7Ô∏è‚É£ of #adecadeofmemories, we‚Äôre reflecting on two initiatives that have made a positive difference for our students.

In 2017, the Board of Trustees approved funding for accessible playgrounds to be installed at all elementary campuses. We are very proud to be one of the only‚Ä¶if not the only‚Ä¶school district in the state of Texas to install all-inclusive playgrounds at every elementary campus and equally proud to be named a National Designation Site for these playgrounds.

During the 2018-2019 school year, Weatherford ISD also became the first school to offer Kanga Care Clinics at every campus. Kanga Care is a partnership between Weatherford ISD and Parker County Hospital District Outreach Program to provide medical care onsite at each campus. With telemedicine and the MedPod Medical Cart, the healthcare needs of both staff and students can be met in a convenient setting with each campus nurse.

Accessible Playgrounds Video Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E-kRKHMm5WE

Kanga Care Video Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kr7DS-Fzzek

- And so much more!

post_text:
Weatherford ISD is one of only 15 school districts and 434 schools across Texas to be named a Project ADAM Heart Safe School District.

Project ADAM began in 1999 after the death of Adam Lemel, a 17-year-old Whitefish Bay, WI, high school student who collapsed and died while playing basketball. Adam suffered a Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA), in which ventricular fibrillation occurred, a condition in which the ventricles cannot pump blood into the body. Defibrillation, or an AED, could have saved his life.

The Project ADAM Heart Safe School designation is attained when schools implement a quality sudden cardiac arrest program of awareness, training and effective emergency response to promote a Heart Safe environment for students, visitors and staff as outlined within the Heart Safe School Checklist.

In collaboration with our campus nurses, each WISD campus has a designated a Cardiac Emergency Response team. This team has been trained in CPR and AED use and an implementation plan in the event of a Sudden Cardiac Arrest.

Adam suffered a Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA), in which ventricular fibrillation occurred, a condition in which the ventricles cannot pump blood into the body. Defibrillation, or an AED, could have saved his life.

The Project ADAM Heart Safe School designation is attained when schools implement a quality sudden cardiac arrest program of awareness, training and effective emergency response to promote a Heart Safe environment for students, visitors and staff as outlined within the Heart Safe School Checklist.

In collaboration with our campus nurses, each WISD campus has a designated a Cardiac Emergency Response team. This team has been trained in CPR and AED use and an implementation plan in the event of a Sudden Cardiac Arrest.

post_text:
We want to let you know about a bus accident that occurred this afternoon. A pickup truck struck the side of a Weatherford ISD bus as it was turning on to Carter Road from FM 51. At the time of this incident, there were 43 students on the bus and one bus driver. EMS immediately responded to the scene to assess the situation and evaluated four students as a precaution.

Weatherford ISD administrators worked closely with the Transportation Department who notified families of the students on the bus and sent a new bus to transport students home. Our thanks to all who worked to make sure our students were safe and transported home as quickly as possible this afternoon.

Our thanks to all who worked to make sure our students were safe and transported home as quickly as possible this afternoon.

At last night's school board meeting, Medical City Weatherford honored the students who submitted the top three designs and presented each student with a framed copy of their artwork.

Students from left to right:
1st Place - Madison Menchaca
2nd Place - Gwen Seeger
3rd Place - Cadence Bumpas

post_text:
Dear WISD Families,

This morning, the Weatherford Police Department was called to the apartments off of College Park Drive because of an individual incident. The police department has since reported the situation has been resolved.

Weatherford ISD students and staff were never in danger, but out of an abundance of caution, Austin Elementary held an inside recess during this time period.
shared_text:
Weatherford Police Department, Texas
November 20, 2019 at 12:26 PM ¬∑

Weatherford Police have been working an incident at an apartment complex on College Park Drive involving an individual that may have been armed. The subject was subsequently located and the incident has been resolved.

The college campus nearby was not in danger and there were no threats directed toward the college or any of its students. Weatherford College Police assisted the Weatherford Police during the incident. We appreciate the assistance of Weatherford College Police, Weatherford Fire Department, LifeCare, Department of Public Safety and Parker County Sheriff's Office to resolve the situation swiftly and safely.

Traffic was re-routed from the area during the incident, however all traffic has been resumed to normal flow.

No further information is available at this time.

post_text:
This year‚Äôs senior class was in kindergarten when Randy Cox and the Cox Financial Group, LLC began donating $100 for every touchdown scored by the Roos.

For 13 years, Randy has given over $38,000 to be split between the football, band, Blue Belles, and cheer booster clubs.

It‚Äôs been a record year for the Kangaroos scoring 62 touchdowns prior to last week‚Äôs game. This year‚Äôs check is estimated to be $6,500 or more‚Ä¶and Randy has agreed to double the rate to $200 for touchdowns in the playoffs!

On Friday evening, Randy and Shari Cox, along with employees from the Cox Financial Group presented a check to the booster clubs in the amount of $6,500.

But the story doesn‚Äôt end there.

Randy has been a Director on the WISD Education Foundation Board since 2006. On Friday night, he surprised us when he announced he was also donating $50 for every touchdown to the Education Foundation!

Our thanks to Randy Cox and Cox Financial Group for their outstanding support of Weatherford ISD.

It‚Äôs been a record year for the Kangaroos scoring 62 touchdowns prior to last week‚Äôs game. This year‚Äôs check is estimated to be $6,500 or more‚Ä¶and Randy has agreed to double the rate to $200 for touchdowns in the playoffs!

On Friday evening, Randy and Shari Cox, along with employees from the Cox Financial Group presented a check to the booster clubs in the amount of $6,500.

But the story doesn‚Äôt end there.

Randy has been a Director on the WISD Education Foundation Board since 2006. On Friday night, he surprised us when he announced he was also donating $50 for every touchdown to the Education Foundation!

Our thanks to Randy Cox and Cox Financial Group for their outstanding support of Weatherford ISD.

We‚Äôre so proud to announce that Kangaroo QB Ken Seals is one of the top 25 semifinalists for Dave Campbell‚Äôs Mr. Texas Football Player of the Year!

Mr. Texas Football presented by Wells Fargo annually recognizes the most outstanding high school football player in the state of Texas. Each week, fans are given a chance to vote for the player of the week on TexasFootball.com. On December 6th, 10 finalists will be named. Fans can then cast their vote as to who should be named Mr. Texas Football. The winner of the 2019 Mr. Texas Football Award presented by Wells Fargo will be announced prior to the 2019 Academy Sports + Outdoors Texas Bowl, which will be played on Friday, Dec. 27 at NRG Stadium in Houston. (Source: Dave Campbell‚Äôs Texas Football website)

Weatherford High School English teacher Clif Tramel was this week‚Äôs recipient of the Roger‚Äôs Roo Pride Award.

Mr. Tramel is passionate about helping our students and passionate about the subject he teaches. His ‚Äúin class essays‚Äù are legendary‚Ä¶and he is visited by college students every year who are so grateful to have had him as a teacher.

Mr. Tramel goes the extra mile. He helps students with their college essays, and helps plan the WHS Honors Banquet and high school graduation. He‚Äôs also been the announcer for Kangaroo baseball games for the past 17 years.

It was appropriate that we honored Mr. Tramel on senior night because he is always recognized by a senior student at the Honors Banquet as their most influential teacher.

Please join us in congratulating Clif Tramel - this week‚Äôs recipient of the Roger‚Äôs Roo Pride Award.

post_text:
As a tractor-trailer truck was turning from FM 730 onto Old Dicey Road this afternoon, it clipped one of the mirrors on the hood of Bus 32. There were no injuries to students or to the bus driver. However, the bus was not safe for student transportation without the front mirror.

Weatherford ISD administrators worked closely with the Transportation Department who notified families of the students on the bus and sent a new bus to transport students home. Our thanks to all who worked to make sure our students were safe and transported home as quickly as possible.

post_text: The City of Weatherford is testing the new outdoor warning system this morning. If you hear the sirens, please do not be alarmed - this is only a test of this new product.
shared_text:
City of Weatherford
November 1, 2019 at 10:11 AM ¬∑

We are about to conduct our first test of the new outdoor warning system within the hour. If you hear the sirens, please do not be alarmed as this is only a test. DO NOT CALL POLICE DISPATCH AS WELL.

Various sounds will come from each siren as we audibly test each one. After this test, we will begin our monthly test on Wednesday, December 4 at 1 p.m. These tests will occur thereafter on the first Wednesday of each month in conjunction with the other DFW cities who test theirs during this time. Attached is a map of the siren locations.

PLEASE DO NOT CALL POLICE DISPATCH TO REPORT THE SOUNDS.

post_text:
We are closely monitoring this afternoon's forecast that indicates a chance of thunderstorms. If lightning is occurring at dismissal, we will hold all students inside their campus until the lightning delay is lifted.

While we advise parents who are picking up children from campuses to remain in their cars during a lightning delay, you may choose to come to the office to pick up your child.

Buses will wait at campuses until it is safe for students to board and, as a result, may be delayed in arriving to bus stops this afternoon.

If we experience a lightning delay this afternoon, we will notify parents using our automated calling and email notification system.

Thank you for your understanding as we implement bad weather processes that are designed to keep our children safe.

post_text:
Predicting the weather can be challenging ‚Äì especially when utilizing apps that use weather stations that may be located several miles from Weatherford ISD schools.

To add an additional layer to our weather safety processes, Weatherford ISD recently installed our own weather monitoring station. This weather station allows us to better prepare for and respond to potentially dangerous weather-related events.

The features of the weather station provide us with the opportunity to more accurately obtain weather information directly related to our schools and facilities, monitor air quality, and deploy weather-related processes in a more timely manner.

post_text:
Each month, Weatherford ISD students are introduced to a new Core Essential Value. These are taught to help our schools create a culture of lasting values among students, staff, families, and our community.

This morning, students at Martin Elementary who best demonstrated last month's core value of "trust" were in for a surprise from Chick-fil-A Weatherford! Mary Martin Elementary ROOS

Below are the values for the remainder of the school year:

Courage- Being brave enough to do what you should even when you are scared.

Honor- Letting someone know you see how valuable they really are.

Joy- Finding a way to be happy even when things don't go your way.

Knowlege- Learning something new so you can be better at whatever you do.

Creativity- Using your imagination to do something unique.

Forgiveness- Deciding that someone who wronged you doesn't have to pay.

Humility- Putting others first by giving up what you the you deserve.

Determination- Deciding it's worth it to finish what you started.

Forgiveness- Deciding that someone who wronged you doesn't have to pay.

Humility- Putting others first by giving up what you the you deserve.

Determination- Deciding it's worth it to finish what you started.

post_text:
Weatherford ISD will host the first Roo Parent University of the school year on Tuesday, October 22, 2019. This event is open to all parents and will be held from 6-8 pm at the Ninth Grade Center.

Presentation topics include:
- The ARD Process
- Parenting the Anxious Child
- Futures Planning
- Dyslexia Student Panel
- Behavior: Interventions for the Home
- Speech Generating Devices: Beginners and Advanced

Please join us for a night of learning and light refreshments. Child care will be provided.

For more information, please call 817-598-2844.

Weatherford ISD presented the Roger‚Äôs Roo Pride Award to Bob Caughman at Thursday night‚Äôs football game.

Bob is a proud member of the Weatherford High School Class of 1962 and a loyal Kangaroo fan.

In 1997, Bob was hired as teacher at our Bridge Campus. He touched the lives of hundreds of Weatherford High School students before retiring in 2013.

Bob has a heart for the Weatherford community and for Weatherford ISD. And, since 1963 he‚Äôs been in stands of Kangaroo Stadium cheering for our Roos!

Bob‚Äôs daughter, Dee Truelove, joined him on the field for this special recognition. üíô

post_text:
In 2014, Weatherford ISD started a new tradition honoring a True Blue Kangaroo Fan at home football games. This award celebrates a fan who is a loyal Kangaroo, promotes Roo Pride, has extreme Kangaroo spirit, and supports our students by attending high school games and events.

When Weatherford ISD created this award, it was a without doubt the first recipient should be our former teacher, Pizza Place owner, and the epitome of all things Roo Pride. Roger Grizzard was presented the first True Blue Kangaroo Fan Award on Friday, September 5, 2014.

This past Friday, the Grizzard family and former recipients of the True Blue Kangaroo Fan award were on the field when we announced this award will forever be called Roger‚Äôs Roo Pride Award in memory of our dear friend and colleague. #LiveLikeRoger

post_text:
At last night's school board meeting, the Board of Trustees recognized H-E-B for their partnership with the school district and the Weatherford ISD Education Foundation.

H-E-B is known throughout the state for their involvement in the community and their outstanding support of education through their Excellence in Education awards, their Read 3 program, and donations that total more than $10 million annually.

When the Hudson Oaks H-E-B opened in May, we immediately felt their support. At their VIP opening, they talked about their culture and their commitment to education and they followed that with a very generous donation to the Weatherford ISD Education Foundation of $5,000.

In August, they provided H-E-B shopping bags for all of our new professionals and teachers. They delighted our entire staff by serving a delicious lunch to all of our employees just before Convocation. And, they are a major sponsor of the Education Foundation‚Äôs A Taste for Education fundraiser to be held on October 19, 2019.

Our thanks to H-E-B!

Important Weather Message

Please be aware that some campuses may be on a hold at dismissal time this afternoon due to lightning in our area. If a campus is on hold, buses will wait until it is safe for students to board. Parents should expect bus delays as a result.

Thank you for your understanding as we implement a bad weather process designed to keep your children safe.

Important Weather Message

Please be aware that some campuses may be on a hold at dismissal time this afternoon due to lightning in our area. If a campus is on hold, buses will wait until it is safe for students to board. Parents should expect bus delays as a result.

Thank you for your understanding as we implement a bad weather process designed to keep your children safe.

post_text:
We are closely monitoring weather conditions this afternoon.

Weatherford ISD subscribes to Perry Weather, a service that includes access to a meteorologist for our area. We also follow the weather on local media stations and use several weather apps.

In the event a severe weather warning (such as lightning) is in progress at our school release time, we will hold all students in the building until the threat is lifted. In this situation, we will also hold buses. As a result, bus transportation may be delayed.

Should it become necessary to communicate with parents this afternoon regarding the weather, we will use our SchoolMessenger system to send calls/emails/texts to parents and post information on the Weatherford ISD website and social media sites (Facebook and Twitter).

We appreciate your support as we work to ensure the safety of our students, parents, and staff.

We are monitoring weather conditions this morning and will continue to do so throughout the day. During a lightning warning, students on buses will remain on the bus until it is safe to move to the building. We encourage you to use your judgement in dropping off your children at bus stops and our schools. Our desire is to keep students and staff as safe as possible during a weather event. If a lightning warning is in progress at drop off or pick up times, we will hold all students on the buses or in the building until the warning is lifted. This allows students and staff to remain safe. As a result, bus transportation will be delayed.

Should it become necessary to notify parents during a severe weather event, we will use our automated calling system and text notification process.

We appreciate your support as we work to ensure the safety of our students, parents, and staff.

post_text:
Welcome to our new School Resource Officer - Kayla Callaway. Officer Callaway has been a law enforcement officer for seven years (three years with Stephenville PD and four years with Weatherford PD). During the last four years, Officer Callaway held a variety of assignments including patrol, crime scene team, training officer and she is a member of the Marine Safety Team.

Additionally, she has been awarded Officer of the Year at Weatherford PD, Officer of the Year from the American Legion, and The State of Texas Officer of the Year from the American Legion.

Officer Callaway earned the Texas Commission on Law Enforcement Advanced Peace Officer Certification and holds a Bachelor of Interdisciplinary Science degree from Sam Houston State University.

Pleasing join us in welcoming Officer Callaway to WISD.

We had a GREAT time welcoming with our new teachers and professionals today at our annual New Teacher Orientation!

Special thanks to EECU Credit Union for sponsoring a great breakfast; to Jerry's Cadillac for sponsoring our centerpieces and a delicious lunch; to Plains Capital Bank for sponsoring a tasty Ice Cream Buffet Bar; to North Side Baptist Church and the Weatherford ISD Education Foundation for supporting those teachers that are starting their careers; to H-E-B for providing goody bags, and to the Weatherford Chamber and all the local businesses who filled these goody bags with supplies for our new teachers! And our lunch speakers - Dr. Hanks, Dave Cowley, Van Houser, Donna Dickinson, and Brian Catlin - welcomed our new employees with great messages.

Our community truly came together to help us create a special day filled with moments for our newest employees!

#WhyWISD #RooPride #WelcomeToWeatherfordISD #WeatherfordISDOffersLargeSchoolOpportunitiesWithASmallTownApproach

We're so excited to announce the WHS Blue Belles have accepted an exclusive invitation to perform at the halftime of the Valero Alamo Bowl on Tuesday, December 31, 2019.

The 68 member Blue Belle team will be the feature halftime performers during the bowl game between NCAA teams from the Big 12 and PAC 12 conferences. The Alamo Bowl is played in the Alamodome in San Antonio in front of more than 60,000 enthusiastic football fans on ESPN.

post_text:
Please join us in welcoming Steve Quy back to our Kangaroo family!

Coach Quy was recently named the tennis coach for Weatherford High School. He is a 1989 graduate of Weatherford High School and holds both a Bachelor‚Äôs and Master's degree from the University of North Texas.

Coach Quy began his career at Keller Fossil Ridge High School in 1996 where he served as head tennis coach for six years. From 2004-2016 he served as head tennis coach at Krum High School where led his teams to nine consecutive district championships, six state appearances, and in 2010 was named the 2A Texas Coach of the Year. Most recently he has served as head tennis coach at Cedar Hill High School and assistant coach at Eaton High School.

#WelcomeBack! #RooPride

post_text:
At last night‚Äôs Regular Meeting of the Weatherford ISD Board of Trustees, Dr. Jeffrey Bradley was unanimously approved as the new Principal at Tison Middle School.

Dr. Bradley is beginning his 19th year of service in public education, most recently serving as the Associate Principal of the Ninth Grade Center. He holds a Bachelor of Mathematics and a Masters of Education in Secondary Education, both from Texas Christian University, and a Doctorate in Educational Leadership from the University of North Texas.

Jennifer Bridges was named Associate Principal of the Ninth Grade Center.
Mrs. Bridges, who most recently served as the Assistant Principal at the Ninth Grade Center, holds a Bachelor of Arts and English from Sam Houston State University and a Master‚Äôs Degree in Educational Management from the University of Houston. She is starting her 16th year in public education.

Please join us in congratulating Dr. Jeffrey Bradley and Jennifer Bridges on their new positions!

post_text:
The Weatherford ISD Custodial Services Employee of the Year knows every student in her building and keeps every inch of the campus spotless for students, staff, and parent events‚Ä¶always with a beautiful smile on her face.

One morning this year, a student walking to school accidentally dropped an item needed for class. The bell rang and the student realized they did not have the item needed so they turned around and ran out of the building to retrace their steps. Our custodian saw the student running back to the neighborhood and immediately informed the assistant principal who made sure the student safely returned to school.

Please join us in sending congratulations to Maria Frias - Martin Elementary - the WISD Custodial Services Employee of the Year! .

post_text:
Weatherford ISD is honored to continue our tradition of recognizing valuable members of our Roo family whose work supports our campuses and departments with our annual Staff Recognition Awards. The individuals selected perform their duties in an outstanding manner and make positive contributions to their campus or department.

The Maintenance Employee of the Year has been employed with district for 19 years. He started his career at WISD as a night custodian but his willingness to get the job done was quickly noticed and he was soon promoted. He then became interested in furthering his education in the plumbing trade‚Ä¶earned his apprentice plumber‚Äôs license‚Ä¶and is currently taking evening classes at Weatherford College. You may have seen him repairing outdoor sprinkler systems on our campuses, repairing roof leaks, or addressing dripping sinks. He is an essential part of the Maintenance Department and willing to go above and beyond what is asked of him.

Please join us in congratulating Eloy Ramirez‚Ä¶the 2019 Maintenance Department Employee of the Year.

post_text:
Jeff Lemons has been named the Lady Roos softball coach for Weatherford High School. A 1983 graduate of Weatherford High School, Jeff was an assistant coach for the Lady Roos softball state finalist team in 1999 and the WHS state championship team in 2000.

Coach Lemons served as the head softball coach at Euless Trinity from 2001-2009 and at Aledo High School where his team was the 4A state champion in 2014 and 2015. In 2013, he was name the Texas Girls Coaches Association All Star Coach. He was also named the Texas Association of Sportswriters Coach of the Year in 2014 and 2015.

Coach Lemons received his Bachelor of Science degree in Animal Science from Texas A&M University. He and his wife Carolyn (Austin Elementary librarian) have two children, Justin and Morgan.

post_text:
The Weatherford ISD Board of Trustees unanimously approved Marilisa Moore as Principal for Crockett Elementary School at last night's Special Meeting.

Mrs. Moore began her career in Weatherford ISD in 2012 and has worked in various positions in the district, most recently serving as Assistant Principal at Wright Elementary.

She holds a Bachelors of Interdisciplinary Studies from the University of North Texas and a Master's of Educational Administration from Lamar University.

Please join us in congratulating Marilisa on her new position!

She holds a Bachelors of Interdisciplinary Studies from the University of North Texas and a Master's of Educational Administration from Lamar University.

Please join us in congratulating Marilisa on her new position!

post_text:
The Kangaroo Mascot

Hopping through the Australian Outback, kangaroos can move forward at rates topping forty miles per hour. In fact, it is almost impossible for these unique animals to move backwards!

Ever wonder why our mascot is a kangaroo? Legend has it that in the early 1920s, Ray Morrison - a beloved coach at WHS - left the high school to accept a position at Austin College located in Sherman, TX. Because Coach Morrison was so admired, Weatherford High School honored him by adopting the kangaroo (the Austin College mascot) as the WHS mascot. #NationalMascotDay

June 5, 2019 at 8:56 AM ¬∑

The Weatherford ISD Education Foundation

post_text:
Weatherford ISD's Healthy Kids summer lunch program kicks off on Monday, June 3rd. The program offers free lunches to all children who are 18 years old and younger. Healthy Kids free lunches will be offered Monday - Friday thru July 29th.

Over 53,000 children have been provided meals through Weatherford ISD's Healthy Kids program since 2014.

Meals include hot baked entrees such as popcorn chicken, chicken nuggets, and sandwiches - along with fresh fruits and vegetables. Funded through a Texas Department of Agriculture program, the meals are prepared and served by Weatherford ISD‚Äôs Child Nutrition department and meet all federal and state nutrition guidelines.

To receive a meal, children should visit one of the locations on the photo, Monday-Friday from 11:30 am - 1:00 pm.
#WhyWISD #MoreThanAGrade

post_text:
Congratulations to Kylie Fuller and Jade Hebbert for being named the Valedictorian and Salutatorian, respectively, for the WHS Class of 2019!

Kylie is the daughter of Kelly and Reggie Fuller. After graduation, she plans to attend Johns Hopkins University and major in neuroscience.

Jade is the daughter of Kila Rennaker and Bruce Hebbert. Following graduation, she plans to travel abroad, study, volunteer and then attend the University of Texas as a journalism major.

Pictured left to right: Kylie Fuller (Valedictorian) and Jade Hebbert (Salutatorian)
